decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Permission Expires (Advert Consent) - This consent shall expire 5 years from the date of this decision.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site Plan; Site Location Plan; CSI 186 A; CSI 186 B; CSI 186 B (Proposed photo) CSI 186 C;
Condition : 3 - Owner's Permission - No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

Condition : 4 - Hazards - No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to endanger persons using any highway, railway, waterway, dock, harbour or aerodrome (civil or military), obscure or hinder the ready interpretation of any traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or hinder the operation of any device used for the purpose of security or surveillance or for measuring the speed of any vehicle.

Condition : 5 - Clean and Tidy Condition - Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity of the site.
Condition : 6 - Safety - Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.

Condition : 7 - Removal if Necessary - Where an Advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.

Condition : 8 - The proposed signage must operate at an illumination no greater than 300cd/m2 between dusk and dawn, consistent with the guidance set out in the Institute of Lighting Professionals (ILP) publication: "The Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements" (PLG05, January 2015).

Reason: To ensure advertisements do not become a distraction, in the interests of the pedestrian and highway safety and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies DM D5, DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 9 - The proposed signage must not have any intermittent light source, moving feature, animation or exposed cold cathode tubing. 

Reason: To ensure advertisements do not become a distraction, in the interests of the pedestrian and highway safety and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies DM D5, DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.
Condition : 10 - This advertisement consent does not purport to grant and form of consent for alterations to the frontage of the building and relates to the proposed advertisements only.
description: APPLICATION FOR ADVERT CONSENT FOR THE DISPLAY OF INDIVIDUAL HALO INTERNALLY ILLUMINATED LETTERS AND 1 X EXTERNALLY ILLUMINATED AMENITY BOARD
